content: Samuel Addresses Israel
Then Samuel said to all Israel, “Behold, I have listened to your voice for all that you said to me, and I have appointed a king over you.
Now, here is the king walking before you, but as for me, I am old and gray, and my sons are here with you. And I have walked before you since my youth to this day.

Here I am; testify against me before the  and His anointed. Whose ox have I taken, or whose donkey have I taken, or whom have I exploited? Whom have I oppressed, or from whose hand have I taken a bribe to close my eyes with it? I will return  to you.”
And they said, “You have not exploited us or oppressed us, or taken anything from anyone’s hand.”
So he said to them, “The  is witness against you, and His anointed is witness this day that you have found nothing in my hand.” And they said, “ witness.”
Then Samuel said to the people, “It is the  who appointed Moses and Aaron and who brought your fathers up from the land of Egypt.
Now then, take your stand, so that I may enter into judgment with you before the  concerning all the righteous acts of the  that He did for you and your fathers.
When Jacob went into Egypt and your fathers cried out to the , then the  sent Moses and Aaron who brought your fathers out of Egypt and settled them in this place.

But they forgot the  their God, so He sold them into the hand of Sisera, commander of the army of Hazor, and into the hand of the Philistines, and into the hand of the king of Moab, and they fought against them.
They cried out to the  and said, ‘We have sinned, because we have abandoned the  and have served the Baals and the Ashtaroth; but now save us from the hands of our enemies, and we will serve You.’
Then the  sent Jerubbaal, Bedan, Jephthah, and Samuel, and saved you from the hands of your enemies all around, so that you lived in security.
The King Confirmed
But when you saw that Nahash the king of the sons of Ammon was coming against you, you said to me, ‘No, but a king shall reign over us!’ Yet the  your God  your king.
And now, behold, the king whom you have chosen, whom you have asked for, and behold, the  has put a king over you.
If you will fear the  and serve Him, and listen to His voice and not rebel against the command of the , then both you and the king who reigns over you will follow the  your God.
But if you do not listen to the voice of the , but rebel against the command of the , then the hand of the  will be against you, even  against your fathers.
Even now, take your stand and see this great thing which the  is going to do before your eyes.

Is it not the wheat harvest today? I will call to the , that He will send thunder and rain. Then you will know and see that your wickedness is great which you have done in the sight of the , by asking for yourselves a king.”
So Samuel called to the , and the  sent thunder and rain that day; and all the people greatly feared the  and Samuel.
Then all the people said to Samuel, “Pray to the  your God for your servants, so that we do not die; for we have added to all our sins  evil, by asking for ourselves a king.”
Samuel said to the people, “Do not fear. You have committed all this evil, yet do not turn aside from following the , but serve the  with all your heart.
Indeed, you must not turn aside, for  after useless things which cannot benefit or save, because they are useless.
For the  will not abandon His people on account of His great name, because the  has been pleased to make you a people for Himself.
Furthermore, as for me, far be it from me that I would sin against the  by ceasing to pray for you; but I will instruct you in the good and right way.
Only fear the  and serve Him in truth with all your heart; for consider what great things He has done for you.
But if you still do evil, both you and your king will be swept away.”
